Command.Name: AcquisitionAbort
Command.ToolTip: Aborts the acquisition immediately. This will end the capture without completing the current Frame or waiting on a trigger. If no Acquisition is in progress, the command is ignored.

Category.Name: AcquisitionControl
Category.ToolTip: The Acquisition Control section describes all features related to image acquisition.
Category.Description: The Acquisition Control section describes all features related to image acquisition.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode. It defines the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.Description: Frames are captured continuously until stopped

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.ToolTip: Starts the Acquisition of the camera. The number of frames captured is specified by AcquisitionMode.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.ToolTip: Stops the Acquisition of the camera at the end of the current Frame. It is mainly used when AcquisitionMode is Continuous but can be used in any acquisition mode

Boolean.Name: BacklightCompensationEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: When the background of the subject is too bright, or when the subject is too dark due to shooting in the AE mode, back light compensation will make the subject appear clearer.
Boolean.Description: When the background of the subject is too bright, or when the subject is too dark due to shooting in the AE mode, back light compensation will make the subject appear clearer.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceWhiteAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels. The white balancing ratios are automatically adjusted. Once: One Push White Balance.
Enumeration.Description: If set to Off the White Balance can be adjusted manually with the Gain factors. Once: One Push White Balance that may be automatically readjusted only at the request of the user (Set to Once and then to Off), assuming that a white subject, in correct lighting conditions, and occupying more than 1/2 of the image, is submitted to the camera. One Push White Balance data is lost when the power is turned off.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White balancing is constantly adjusted by the device
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.The mode is controlled by BalanceWhiteMode.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceWhiteMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels. The white balancing ratios are automatically adjusted
Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels. The white balancing ratios are automatically adjusted.

EnumEntry.Name: Manual
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Manual control of R and B gain, 256 steps each
EnumEntry.Description: Manual control of R and B gain, 256 steps each

EnumEntry.Name: Indoor
EnumEntry.ToolTip: 3200K Base Mode
EnumEntry.Description: 3200K Base Mode

EnumEntry.Name: Outdoor
EnumEntry.ToolTip: 5800K Base Mode
EnumEntry.Description: 5800K Base Mode

EnumEntry.Name: NaLamp
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This is a fixed white balance mode specifically for sodium vapour lamps.
EnumEntry.Description: This is a fixed white balance mode specifically for sodium vapour lamps.

EnumEntry.Name: Auto
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode computes the white balance value output using colour information from the entire screen. It outputs the proper value using the colour temperature radiating from a black subject based on a range of values from 3000 to 7500K. This mode is the factory setting.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode computes the white balance value output using colour information from the entire screen. It outputs the proper value using the colour temperature radiating from a black subject based on a range of values from 3000 to 7500K. This mode is the factory setting.

EnumEntry.Name: AutoTracing
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Auto Tracing White balance (2000 to 10000K)
EnumEntry.Description: Auto Tracing White balance (2000 to 10000K)

EnumEntry.Name: AutoOutdoor
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This is an auto white balance mode specifically for outdoors. It allows you to capture images with natural white balance in the morning and evening.
EnumEntry.Description: This is an auto white balance mode specifically for outdoors. It allows you to capture images with natural white balance in the morning and evening.

EnumEntry.Name: AutoNaLamp
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This is an auto white balance mode that is compatible with sodium vapor lamps.
EnumEntry.Description: This is an auto white balance mode that is compatible with sodium vapor lamps.

Integer.Name: Bright
Integer.ToolTip: Value which is used when ExposureAuto is set to Bright. The bright value sets the Iris and Gain value.
Integer.Description: Value which is used when ExposureAuto is set to Bright. The bright value sets the Iris and Gain value.

Command.Name: BrightReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the Bright value.
Command.Description: Resets the Bright value.

Category.Name: ColorEnhancement
Category.ToolTip: Color Enhancement features
Category.Description: A captured colour image is converted to 256 levels of gray, and the binarisation process is performed to convert all gray levels brighter than the threshold value to white, and all gray levels darker than the threshold value to black. (Any value can be set for the threshold level and hysteresis width.) Furthermore, any colour can be assigned to each of the negative and positive. NOTE: Flickering in images during color enhancement is not an indication of a camera malfunction. It can be reduced with the threshold level, hysteresis width, and edge enhancement settings.

Boolean.Name: ColorEnhancementEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables or disables the Color Enhancement
Boolean.Description: When weak-eyesight people read texts or look at pictures on the display of low vision system, camera provides the binarized mode as well as color mode so that they can read texts and look at pictures more clearly.

Integer.Name: ColorEnhancementHysteresisWidth
Integer.ToolTip: Set the hysteresis to reduce flickering.
Integer.Description: Set the hysteresis to reduce flickering.

Integer.Name: ColorEnhancementThreshold
Integer.ToolTip: Set the threshold level to distinguish back color and text
Integer.Description: Set the threshold level to distinguish back color and text

Enumeration.Name: ColorSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the Color which can be manipulated with ColorValue
Enumeration.Description: Selects the Color which can be manipulated with ColorValue

Integer.Name: ColorValue
Integer.ToolTip: Value of the Selected Color
Integer.Description: Value of the Selected Color

Command.Name: CompScan
Command.ToolTip: Execute white spot compensation
Command.Description: A pixel blemish-masking feature, which can be made to re-evaluate overall CCD pixel blemishes and mask severely flawed pixels automatically upon receiving the COMP SCAN command. This feature helps to mask the flaws found in CCD imagers, even after the camera has been powered on for some time.

Category.Name: Compensation
Category.ToolTip: Exposure Compensation features.
Category.Description: Exposure Compensation features.

Category.Name: DeviceControl
Category.ToolTip: Device control features provides general information and control.
Category.Description: Device control features provides general information and control.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceFirmwareID
Enumeration.ToolTip: Firmware ID of the device
Enumeration.Description: Firmware ID of the device

Integer.Name: DeviceTemperature
Integer.ToolTip: Temperature in degrees Celsius (C).
Integer.Description: Temperature in degrees Celsius (C). The conversion value has an error of +/-3 C, and because the temperature sensor is inside the camera, this value is not the ambient temperature. Use it as a reference value only.

StringReg.Name: DeviceVendorName
StringReg.ToolTip: Name of the manufacturer of the device.
StringReg.Description: Name of the manufacturer of the device.

StringReg.Name: DeviceVersion
StringReg.ToolTip: Version of the device. SW: Software Version FW: Firmware Version
StringReg.Description: Version of the device. SW: Software Version FW: Firmware Version

Category.Name: DeviceVersionCat
Category.ToolTip: Version information of the device.
Category.Description: Version information of the device.

Category.Name: DigitalIOControl
Category.ToolTip: Digital I/O covers the features required to control the general Input and Output signals of the camera.
Category.Description: Digital I/O covers the features required to control the general Input and Output signals of the camera.

Boolean.Name: DisplayEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: If enabled information about some features is displayed on the image. E.g. WDR if Wide Dynamic Range is enabled.
Boolean.Description: If enabled information about some features is displayed on the image. E.g. WDR if Wide Dynamic Range is enabled.

Integer.Name: EdgeEnhancement
Integer.ToolTip: Adjusts the enhancement of the edges of objects in the picture. There are 16 levels of adjustment, starting from no enhancement. When shooting text, this control may help by making them sharper.
Integer.Description: Adjusts the enhancement of the edges of objects in the picture. There are 16 levels of adjustment, starting from no enhancement. When shooting text, this control may help by making them sharper.

Category.Name: EdgeEnhancementCat
Category.ToolTip: Adjusts the enhancement of the edges of objects in the picture. There are 16 levels of adjustment, starting from no enhancement. When shooting text, this control may help by making them sharper.
Category.Description: Adjusts the enhancement of the edges of objects in the picture. There are 16 levels of adjustment, starting from no enhancement. When shooting text, this control may help by making them sharper.

Command.Name: EdgeEnhancementReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the Edge Enhancement Value.
Command.Description: Resets the Edge Enhancement Value.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionEnd
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique Identifier of the AcquisitionEnd type of Event. Its value uniquely identify the type event received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique Identifier of the AcquisitionEnd type of Event. Its value uniquely identify the type event received.

Category.Name: EventAcquisitionEndData
Category.ToolTip: Data of the AcquisitionEnd event.
Category.Description: Data of the AcquisitionEnd event.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionEndTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the AquisitionEnd Event. It can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. It determines precisely when the event occured.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the AquisitionEnd Event. It can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. It determines precisely when the event occured.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionStart
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique Identifier of the AcquisitionStart type of Event. Its value uniquely identify the type event received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique Identifier of the AcquisitionStart type of Event. Its value uniquely identify the type event received.

Category.Name: EventAcquisitionStartData
Category.ToolTip: Data of the AcquisitionStart event.
Category.Description: Data of the AcquisitionStart event.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionStartTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the AquisitionStart Event. It can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. It determines precisely when the event occured.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the AquisitionStart Event. It can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. It determines precisely when the event occured.

Category.Name: EventControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Event control features.
Category.Description: Category that contains Event control features.

Enumeration.Name: EventNotification
Enumeration.ToolTip: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.
Enumeration.Description: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is disabled.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is enabled.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is enabled.

Enumeration.Name: EventSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Event to control. If activated with EventNotification this event sends a signal to the host application.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Event to control. If activated with EventNotification this event sends a signal to the host application.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the Acquisition of one or many Frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the Acquisition of one or many Frames.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the Acquisition of one or many Frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the Acquisition of one or many Frames.

Category.Name: Exposure
Category.ToolTip: Features for the exposure modes and shutter.
Category.Description: Features for the exposure modes and shutter.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: A variety of AE functions are available for optimal output of subjects in lighting conditions that range from low to high.
Enumeration.Description: A variety of AE functions are available for optimal output of subjects in lighting conditions that range from low to high.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Manual control mode. Variable Shutter, Iris and Gain

EnumEntry.Name: FullAuto
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Automatic exposure mode. Exposure duration is constantly adapted by the camera. Auto Iris and Gain, Fixed Shutter Speed.

EnumEntry.Name: ShutterPriority
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Shutter priority automatic exposure mode.
EnumEntry.Description: Shutter priority automatic exposure mode. Variable Shutter Speed, Auto Iris and Gain. Flicker can be eliminated by setting shutter to 1/120s.

EnumEntry.Name: IrisPriority
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Iris priority automatic exposure mode. Variable Iris (F1.6 to Close, 18 steps), Auto Gain and Shutter speed.

EnumEntry.Name: Bright
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Manual Mode set with Bright. Iris and Gain are disabled when ExposureAuto is set to Bright because it sets Iris and Gain automatically.

Category.Name: ExposureAutoSpot
Category.ToolTip: A particular section of the subject can be designated, and then that portion of the image can be weighted and a value computed so that Iris and Gain can be optimized to obtain an image.
Category.Description: In Full Auto AE, the level for the entire screen is computed and the optimum Auto Iris and Gain levels are determined. In Spot AE, a particular section of the subject can be designated, and then that portion of the image can be weighted and a value computed so that Iris and Gain can be optimized to obtain an image. For example, in an image with a lot of movement and with varying levels of brightness, portions without much change can be designated as such a spot, and changes to the screen can be minimized in that area. As shown in the diagram below, a range of 16 blocks vertically and 16 blocks horizontally can be designated. In the case where the centre is designated (shown in black), the level is computed along with a weighted value for the surrounding block (shaded), including the specified portions; and then the Gain and Iris are set. The value of the designated portions and the surrounding areas should be calculated as 100%, the rest should be set to 20%. The range of the Spot AE frame is fixed to 5 blocks vertically and 4 blocks horizontally.

Boolean.Name: ExposureAutoSpotEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: If Enabled a particular section of the subject can be designated, and then that portion of the image can be weighted and a value computed so that Iris and Gain can be optimized to obtain an image.
Boolean.Description: If Enabled a particular section of the subject can be designated, and then that portion of the image can be weighted and a value computed so that Iris and Gain can be optimized to obtain an image. For example, in an image with a lot of movement and with varying levels of brightness, portions without much change can be designated as such a spot, and changes to the screen can be minimized in that area. As shown in the diagram below, a range of 16 blocks vertically and 16 blocks horizontally can be designated.

Integer.Name: ExposureAutoSpotX
Integer.ToolTip: X-Position of the spot as one block of 16.
Integer.Description: X-Position of the spot as one block of 16.

Integer.Name: ExposureAutoSpotY
Integer.ToolTip: Y-Position of the spot as one block of 16.
Integer.Description: Y-Position of the spot as one block of 16.

Integer.Name: ExposureCompensation
Integer.ToolTip: Exposure compensation is a function which offsets the internal reference brightness level used in the AE mode.
Integer.Description: Exposure compensation is a function which offsets the internal reference brightness level used in the AE mode, by steps of 1.5 dB from 0 (-10.5 dB) to 14 (10.5dB). 7 is the middle with 0 dB.

Boolean.Name: ExposureCompensationEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Exposure compensation is a function which offsets the internal reference brightness level used in the AE mode.
Boolean.Description: Exposure compensation is a function which offsets the internal reference brightness level used in the AE mode.

Command.Name: ExposureCompensationReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets Exposure Compensation.
Command.Description: Resets Exposure Compensation.

Category.Name: Focus
Category.ToolTip: Focus features.
Category.Description: Focus features.

Integer.Name: FocusAutoIntervalTime
Integer.ToolTip: Time in seconds to the next auto focus in the interval AF Mode.
Integer.Description: Time in seconds to the next auto focus in the interval AF Mode.

Integer.Name: FocusAutoMovementTime
Integer.ToolTip: Time in seconds how long the Focus is active.
Integer.Description: Time in seconds how long the Focus is active.

Command.Name: FocusInfinity
Command.ToolTip: The lens is forcibly moved to a position suitable for an unlimited distance. Available with FocusMode set to Manual.
Command.Description: The lens is forcibly moved to a position suitable for an unlimited distance. Available with FocusMode set to Manual.

Enumeration.Name: FocusMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Set the mode for the Focus. Manual is used with FocusPositionTarget or FocusOnePushAF.
Enumeration.Description: The minimum focus distance is 10 mm at the optical wide end (320, 300 and 290mm default depending on model) and 1500 mm (800mm 18x models) at the optical tele end, and is independent of the digital zoom. The Auto Focus (AF) function automatically adjusts the focus position to maximise the high frequency content of the picture in a centre measurement area, taking into consideration the high luminance and strong contrast components.

EnumEntry.Name: Manual
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Focus is set via FocusPositionTarget or an Auto Focus is triggered once via FocusOnePushAF.
EnumEntry.Description: Focus is set via FocusPositionTarget or an Auto Focus is triggered once via FocusOnePushAF.

EnumEntry.Name: NormalAF
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This is the normal mode for AF operations.
EnumEntry.Description: This is the normal mode for AF operations.

EnumEntry.Name: IntervalAF
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The mode used for AF movements carried out at particular intervals.
EnumEntry.Description: The mode used for AF movements carried out at particular intervals. The time intervals for AF movements and for the timing of the stops can be set in one-second increments using the FocusAutoIntervalTime. The initial value for both is set to five seconds.

EnumEntry.Name: ZoomTriggerAF
EnumEntry.ToolTip: When the zoom is changed, the pre-set value (initially set at 5 seconds) becomes that for AF Mode.
EnumEntry.Description: When the zoom is changed, the pre-set value (initially set at 5 seconds) becomes that for AF Mode. Then, it stops. FocusSensitivity can be set to either Normal or LOW.

Integer.Name: FocusNearLimit
Integer.ToolTip: Can be set in a range from 1000 (infinity) to 49152 (10 mm).
Integer.Description: Can be set in a range from 1000 (infinity) to 49152 (10 mm).

Command.Name: FocusOnePushAF
Command.ToolTip: When a Trigger Command is sent, the lens moves to adjust the focus for the subject. FocusMode has to be set to manual.
Command.Description: When a Trigger Command is sent, the lens moves to adjust the focus for the subject. The focus lens then holds that position until the next Trigger Command is input. FocusMode has to be set to manual.

Integer.Name: FocusPosition
Integer.ToolTip: Current position of the focus.
Integer.Description: Current position of the focus. Can be changed with FocusPositionTarget.

Integer.Name: FocusPositionTarget
Integer.ToolTip: Changes the focus to the target position.
Integer.Description: Changes the focus to the target position.

Enumeration.Name: FocusSensitivity
Enumeration.ToolTip: Auto Focus Sensitivity. NORMAL: Reaches the highest focus speed quickly. LOW: Improves the stability of the focus.
Enumeration.Description: Auto Focus Sensitivity. NORMAL: Reaches the highest focus speed quickly. Use this when shooting a subject that moves frequently. Usually, this is the most appropriate mode. LOW: Improves the stability of the focus. When the lighting level is low, the AF function does not take effect, even though the brightness varies, contributing to a stable image.

Integer.Name: FrameBufferBlocks
Integer.ToolTip: Number of blocks in descriptor FIFO.
Integer.Description: Number of blocks in descriptor FIFO.

IntReg.Name: FrameBufferBlocksDropped
IntReg.ToolTip: Dropped Blocks

Category.Name: FrameBufferCat
Category.ToolTip: Features to control the Frame Buffer.
Category.Description: Features to control the Frame Buffer.

Command.Name: FrameBufferClearStatistic
Command.ToolTip: Clear the Frame Buffer Statistic. Locked while grab is active.
Command.Description: Clear the Frame Buffer Statistic. Locked while grab is active.

Enumeration.Name: FrameBufferDeint
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if deinterlacing is enabled or disabled.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if deinterlacing is enabled or disabled.

IntReg.Name: FrameBufferFifoDropped
IntReg.ToolTip: Number of dropped blocks because FIFO was full.
IntReg.Description: Number of dropped blocks because FIFO was full.

Enumeration.Name: FrameBufferLowLat
Enumeration.ToolTip: When active the frame buffer is optimized for low latency.
Enumeration.Description: When active the frame buffer is optimized for low latency.

IntReg.Name: FrameBufferResend
IntReg.ToolTip: Number of Resend Requests

IntReg.Name: FrameBufferResendFailed
IntReg.ToolTip: Number of failed resend requests.

IntReg.Name: FrameBufferResendSuccess
IntReg.ToolTip: Successful Resend Requests.

Integer.Name: Gain
Integer.ToolTip: Selected Gain can be controlled. Gain All is available when ExposureAuto is off. Red and Blue Gain are available when BalanceWhiteAuto is off and BalanceWhiteMode is manual.
Integer.Description: Selected Gain can be controlled. Gain All is available when ExposureAuto is off. Red and Blue Gain are available when BalanceWhiteAuto is off and BalanceWhiteMode is manual.

Integer.Name: GainLimit
Integer.ToolTip: The gain limit can be set in the AE mode. Use this setting when image signal-to-noise ratio is particularly important.
Integer.Description: The gain limit can be set in the AE mode. Use this setting when image signal-to-noise ratio is particularly important.

Command.Name: GainReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the selected Gain to the default value
Command.Description: Resets the selected Gain to the default value

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Gain is controlled. Gain All is available when ExposureAuto is off. Red and Blue Gain are available when BalanceWhiteAuto is off and BalanceWhiteMode is manual.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Gain is controlled. Gain All is available when ExposureAuto is off. Red and Blue Gain are available when BalanceWhiteAuto is off and BalanceWhiteMode is manual.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to all channels
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to all channels

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the red channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the red channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the blue channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the blue channel.

Enumeration.Name: GevCCP
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the device access privilege of an application.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application.

Category.Name: GevControlChannel
Category.ToolTip: Control Channel features.
Category.Description: Control Channel features.

IntReg.Name: GevCurrentDefaultGateway
IntReg.ToolTip: Reports the default gateway IP address to be used on the given network interface.
IntReg.Description: Reports the default gateway IP address to be used on the given network interface.

Category.Name: GevCurrentIP
Category.ToolTip: Current IP configuration.
Category.Description: Current IP configuration.

IntReg.Name: GevCurrentIPAddress
IntReg.ToolTip: Reports the IP address for the given network interface.
IntReg.Description: Reports the IP address for the given network interface.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationDHCP
Boolean.ToolTip: Controls whether the DHCP IP configuration scheme is activated.
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the DHCP IP configuration scheme is activated.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationLLA
Boolean.ToolTip: Controls whether the Link Local Address IP configuration scheme is activated.
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the Link Local Address IP configuration scheme is activated.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Boolean.ToolTip: Controls whether the PersistentIP configuration scheme is activated.
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the PersistentIP configuration scheme is activated.

IntReg.Name: GevCurrentSubnetMask
IntReg.ToolTip: Reports the subnet mask of the given interface.
IntReg.Description: Reports the subnet mask of the given interface.

Category.Name: GevDeviceMode
Category.ToolTip: Information about device mode of operation.
Category.Description: Information about device mode of operation.

Enumeration.Name: GevDeviceModeCharacterSet
Enumeration.ToolTip: Character encoding of strings in this device.
Enumeration.Description: Character encoding of strings in this device.

EnumEntry.Name: UTF8
EnumEntry.ToolTip: UTF-8
EnumEntry.Description: UTF-8

Boolean.Name: GevDeviceModeIsBigEndian
Boolean.ToolTip: Endianess of the device: True if big-endian; False for little-endian.
Boolean.Description: Endianess of the device: True if big-endian; False for little-endian.

Integer.Name: GevDiscoveryAckDelay
Integer.ToolTip: Randomized delay in ms to acknowledge a DISCOVERY_CMD.
Integer.Description: Indicates the maximum randomized delay the device will wait to acknowledge a discovery command.

StringReg.Name: GevFirstURL
StringReg.ToolTip: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file. The First URL is used as the first choice by the application to retrieve the XML device description file.
StringReg.Description: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file. The First URL is used as the first choice by the application to retrieve the XML device description file.

Boolean.Name: GevGVCPHeartbeatDisable
Boolean.ToolTip: Disables the GVCP heartbeat.
Boolean.Description: Disables the GVCP heartbeat.

Boolean.Name: GevGVCPPendingAck
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the generation of PENDING_ACK.
Boolean.Description: Enables the generation of PENDING_ACK.

MaskedIntReg.Name: GevGVCPPendingTimeout
MaskedIntReg.ToolTip: Indicates the longest GVCP command execution time before a device returns a PENDING_ACK.
MaskedIntReg.Description: Indicates the longest GVCP command execution time before a device returns a PENDING_ACK.

Integer.Name: GevHeartbeatTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Heartbeat timeout in ms.
Integer.Description: The device uses this timeout to close a connection if in this timespan no GVCP command was issued.

Category.Name: GevIPConfiguration
Category.ToolTip: Controls which IP configuration is used.
Category.Description: Controls which IP configuration is used.

Enumeration.Name: GevIPConfigurationStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Reports the current IP configuration status.
Enumeration.Description: Reports the current IP configuration status.

Integer.Name: GevMACAddress
Integer.ToolTip: MAC address of the device.
Integer.Description: MAC address of the device.

IntReg.Name: GevMCDA
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the destination IP address for the message channel.
IntReg.Description: Controls the destination IP address for the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the port to which the device must send messages. Setting this value to 0 closes the message channel.
Integer.Description: Controls the port to which the device must send messages. Setting this value to 0 closes the message channel.

IntReg.Name: GevMCRC
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the number of retransmissions allowed when a message channel message times out.

MaskedIntReg.Name: GevMCSP
MaskedIntReg.ToolTip: This feature indicates the source port for the message channel.
MaskedIntReg.Description: This feature indicates the source port for the message channel.

IntReg.Name: GevMCTT
IntReg.ToolTip: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.
IntReg.Description: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.

Category.Name: GevMessageChannel
Category.ToolTip: Message Channel Features.
Category.Description: Message Channel Features.

Integer.Name: GevMessageChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of supported message channels.
Integer.Description: Number of supported message channels.

IntReg.Name: GevPersistentDefaultGateway
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the persistent default gateway for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.
IntReg.Description: Controls the persistent default gateway for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Category.Name: GevPersistentIP
Category.ToolTip: Persistent IP settings for the selected interface.
Category.Description: Persistent IPs are saved in the device's non-volatile memory and thus stay even when the device is without power.

IntReg.Name: GevPersistentIPAddress
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the Persistent IP address for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.
IntReg.Description: Controls the Persistent IP address for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

IntReg.Name: GevPersistentSubnetMask
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.
IntReg.Description: Controls the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

IntReg.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationIPAddress
IntReg.ToolTip: Returns the address of the primary application.
IntReg.Description: Returns the address of the primary application.

MaskedIntReg.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationSocket
MaskedIntReg.ToolTip: Returns the UDP source port of the primary application.
MaskedIntReg.Description: Returns the UDP source port of the primary application.

IntReg.Name: GevSCDA
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the destination IP address to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the destination IP address from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.
IntReg.Description: Controls the destination IP address to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the destination IP address from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.

IntReg.Name: GevSCPD
IntReg.ToolTip: Controls the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel. Increasing this value decreases used bandwidth of the streaming channel.
IntReg.Description: Controls the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel. Increasing this value decreases used bandwidth of the streaming channel.

MaskedIntReg.Name: GevSCPHostPort
MaskedIntReg.ToolTip: Controls the port to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the port from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream. Setting this value to 0 closes the stream channel.
MaskedIntReg.Description: Controls the port to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the port from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream. Setting this value to 0 closes the stream channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSDoNotFragment
Boolean.ToolTip: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet.
Boolean.Description: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet.

Integer.Name: GevSCPSPacketSize
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the stream packet size in bytes to send on this channel.
Integer.Description: Specifies the stream packet size in bytes to send on this channel.

MaskedIntReg.Name: GevSCSP
MaskedIntReg.ToolTip: Indicates the source port of the stream channel.
MaskedIntReg.Description: Indicates the source port of the stream channel.

StringReg.Name: GevSecondURL
StringReg.ToolTip: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file. This URL is an alternative if the application was unsuccessful to retrieve the device description file using the first URL.
StringReg.Description: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file. This URL is an alternative if the application was unsuccessful to retrieve the device description file using the first URL.

Category.Name: GevStreamChannel
Category.ToolTip: Stream Channel Features.
Category.Description: Stream Channel Features.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOption
Boolean.ToolTip: Returns if the selected GEV option is supported.
Boolean.Description: Returns if the selected GEV option is supported.

Enumeration.Name: GevSupportedOptionSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.

EnumEntry.Name: UserDefinedName
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the Userdefined name register is supported
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the Userdefined name register is supported

EnumEntry.Name: SerialNumber
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the Serial number register is supported
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the Serial number register is supported

EnumEntry.Name: HeartbeatDisable
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the Heartbeat can be disabled
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the Heartbeat can be disabled

EnumEntry.Name: LinkSpeed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the Link Speed registers are supported
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the Link Speed registers are supported

EnumEntry.Name: CCPApplicationSocket
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the CCP Application Port and IP address registers are supported.
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the CCP Application Port and IP address registers are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: ManifestTable
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the Manifest Table is supported.
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the Manifest Table is supported.

EnumEntry.Name: TestData
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the test packet is filled with data from the LFSR generator.
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the test packet is filled with data from the LFSR generator.

EnumEntry.Name: DiscoveryAckDelay
EnumEntry.ToolTip: When Discovery ACK Delay register is supported, this bit indicates that the application can write it. If this bit is 0, the register is read-only.
EnumEntry.Description: When Discovery ACK Delay register is supported, this bit indicates that the application can write it. If this bit is 0, the register is read-only

EnumEntry.Name: DiscoveryAckDelayWritable
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates if the Discovery ACK Delay register is supported
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates if the Discovery ACK Delay register is supported

EnumEntry.Name: ExtendedStatusCodes
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the generation of extended status codes is supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the generation of extended status codes is supported.

EnumEntry.Name: PrimaryApplicationSwitchover
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the authenticate primary application switchover requests are supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the authenticate primary application switchover requests are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: Action
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if Actions are supported
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if ACTION_CMD and ACTION_ACK are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: PendingAck
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the generation of PENDING_ACK is supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the generation of PENDING_ACK is supported.

EnumEntry.Name: EventData
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the EVENTDATA_CMD and EVENTDATA_ACK are supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the EVENTDATA_CMD and EVENTDATA_ACK are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: Event
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the EVENT_CMD and EVENT_ACK are supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the EVENT_CMD and EVENT_ACK are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: PacketResend
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the PACKETRESEND_CMD is supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the PACKETRESEND_CMD is supported.

EnumEntry.Name: WriteMem
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the WRITEMEM_CMD and WRITEMEM_ACK are supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the WRITEMEM_CMD and WRITEMEM_ACK are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: CommandsConcatenation
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if the Multiple operations in a single message are supported.
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if the Multiple operations in a single message are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: IPConfigurationLLA
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if Link Local Address IP configuration scheme is supported
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if Link Local Address IP configuration scheme is supported

EnumEntry.Name: IPConfigurationDHCP
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if DHCP IP configuration scheme is supported
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if DHCP IP configuration scheme is supported

EnumEntry.Name: IPConfigurationPersistentIP
EnumEntry.ToolTip: It indicates if PersistentIP configuration scheme is supported
EnumEntry.Description: It indicates if PersistentIP configuration scheme is supported

EnumEntry.Name: StreamChannelSourceSocket
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates the SCSP register (stream channel source port) is available
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates the SCSP register (stream channel source port) is available

EnumEntry.Name: MessageChannelSourceSocket
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates the MCSP register (message channel source port) is available
EnumEntry.Description: Indicates the MCSP register (message channel source port) is available

EnumEntry.Name: StreamChannel0BigAndLittleEndian
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Stream Channel0 Big And Little Endian

Category.Name: GevTimestamp
Category.ToolTip: Timestamp related features.
Category.Description: Timestamp control features.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlLatch
Command.ToolTip: Latches the current timestamp value into the GevTimestampValue feature.
Command.Description: The latch is necessary as the high and low 32bit word are read independenty and must stay in sync.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the timestamp value to zero.
Command.Description: Resets the timestamp value to zero.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampTickFrequency
Integer.ToolTip: Number of timestamp clock ticks in one second.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of timestamp ticks in 1 second (frequency in Hz).

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the latched 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.
Integer.Description: Returns the latched 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.

Category.Name: GevVersion
Category.ToolTip: GigE Vision version number.
Category.Description: GigE Vision version number.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMajor
Integer.ToolTip: GigE Vision major version number.
Integer.Description: GigE Vision major version number.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMinor
Integer.ToolTip: GigE Vision minor version number.
Integer.Description: GigE Vision minor version number.

Integer.Name: Height
Integer.ToolTip: Height of the image in pixels. Default is the height of the effective pixels (580 pixels).
Integer.Description: Height of the image in pixels. Default is the height of the effective pixels (580 pixels).

Boolean.Name: HighResolutionEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: A newly developed ISP function enables the filtering of signals. This allows the camera to provide images with a high resolution.
Boolean.Description: A newly developed ISP function enables the filtering of signals. This allows the camera to provide images with a high resolution (550 TV lines).

Enumeration.Name: ICRMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Set to On to disengage the infrared (IR) Cut-Filter from the image path for increased sensitivity in low light environments. Auto: The ICR will automatically engage depending on the ambient light (available if Auto Exposure is set to one of the auto modes). The image becomes black and white when ICRMode is On.
Enumeration.Description: An infrared (IR) Cut-Filter can be disengaged from the image path for increased sensitivity in low light environments. Auto: The ICR will automatically engage depending on the ambient light, allowing the camera to be effective in day/night environments (available if Auto Exposure is set to one of the auto modes). Note: When in Auto ICR OFF state and WB data is added (default), a malfunction may occur when the subjects largely consisting of blue and green colors are taken.

Category.Name: IRCut
Category.ToolTip: IR Cut Remove (ICR Mode)
Category.Description: An infrared (IR) Cut-Filter can be disengaged from the image path for increased sensitivity in low light environments. The ICR will automatically engage depending on the ambient light, allowing the camera to be effective in day/night environments. When the auto ICR mode is set to ON, the image becomes black and white.

Category.Name: ImageFormatControl
Category.ToolTip: Image Format Control Features.
Category.Description: Image Format Control Features.

Category.Name: Initialize
Category.ToolTip: Initialize features.
Category.Description: Initialize features.

Command.Name: InitializeLens
Command.ToolTip: Initialises the zoom and focus of the lens. It is recommended that the lens is initialised after long periods of inactivity.
Command.Description: Initialises the zoom and focus of the lens. It is recommended that the lens is initialised after long periods of inactivity.

Enumeration.Name: Iris
Enumeration.ToolTip: Change the Iris of the Lens. Available when ExposureAuto is off.
Enumeration.Description: Change the Iris of the Lens. Available when ExposureAuto is off.

Category.Name: IrisCat
Category.ToolTip: Iris features.
Category.Description: Iris features.

Command.Name: IrisReset
Command.ToolTip: Reset to the default Iris position (F1.6). Available when ExposureAuto is off.
Command.Description: Reset to the default Iris position (F1.6). Available when ExposureAuto is off.

Enumeration.Name: LineMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Returns if the current selected Line is a digital input or digital output.
Enumeration.Description: Returns if the current selected Line is a digital input or digital output.

IntReg.Name: LinePitch
IntReg.ToolTip: Total number of bytes between 2 successive lines. This feature is used to facilitate alignment of image data.
IntReg.Description: Total number of bytes between 2 successive lines. This feature is used to facilitate alignment of image data.

Enumeration.Name: LineSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the physical pin of the external camera connectors. All Inputs and Outputs use TTL as signal (0V low 5V high).
Enumeration.Description: Selects the physical pin of the external camera connectors. All Inputs and Outputs use TTL as signal (0V low 5V high).

EnumEntry.Name: Line0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital Output 0. Located on the Primary connector (SubD DA-15). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out0(+): Pin 12 Out0 Ground(-): Pin 13
EnumEntry.Description: Digital Output 0. Located on the Primary connector (SubD DA-15). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out0(+): Pin 12 Out0 Ground(-): Pin 13

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital Output 1. Located on the Secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out1(+): Pin 14 Out1 Ground(-): Pin 9
EnumEntry.Description: Digital Output 1. Located on the Secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out1(+): Pin 14 Out1 Ground(-): Pin 9

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital Input 0. Located on the Primary connector (SubD DA-15). Use only a TTL signal (0V low 5V high). In0(+): Pin 14 In0 Ground(-): Pin 15
EnumEntry.Description: Digital Input 0. Located on the Primary connector (SubD DA-15). Use only a TTL signal (0V low 5V high). In0(+): Pin 14 In0 Ground(-): Pin 15

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital Input 1. Located on the Secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). Use only a TTL signal (0V low 5V high). In1(+): Pin 12 In1 Ground(-): Pin 7
EnumEntry.Description: Digital Input 1. Located on the Secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). Use only a TTL signal (0V low 5V high). In1(+): Pin 12 In1 Ground(-): Pin 7

Boolean.Name: LineStatus
Boolean.ToolTip: Returns the current status of the selected input or output Line.
Boolean.Description: Returns the current status of the selected input or output Line. LineStatus can take any of the following values: TRUE: The level of the Line signal is High. FALSE: The level of the Line signal is Low.

Boolean.Name: Mirror
Boolean.ToolTip: Reverses the video output from the camera horizontally.
Boolean.Description: Reverses the video output from the camera horizontally.

Integer.Name: NoiseReduction
Integer.ToolTip: The Noise Reduction feature removes noise to provide clearer images. Can be set from 0 (off) to 5 (max) 3 is default.
Integer.Description: The NR (Noise Reduction) function removes noise (both random and non-random) to provide clearer images. By combining 2D filtering (spatial) according to brightness and image colour, and 3D filtering (temporal) according to noise caused by motion and time difference, lower-noise images can be obtained for the corresponding image brightness of a moving subject. This function has six steps: levels 1 to 5, plus off. Level 1 applies to subject motion mainly using 2D filter effects. With level 5, 2D and 3D filter effects are maximized, providing the lowest-noise images, although moving subjects may show trails. At each level, two filters are set according to noise and image motion characteristics, so the available level selections depend on the situation. The default setting is level 3.

Integer.Name: OffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: Horizontal offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels). Default is 2. Max value depends on width.
Integer.Description: Horizontal offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels). Default is 2. Max value depends on width.

Integer.Name: OffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Vertical offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels). Default is 0. Max value depends on height.
Integer.Description: Vertical offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels). Default is 0. Max value depends on height.

Enumeration.Name: OutputFramerate
Enumeration.Description: Select output framerate

Enumeration.Name: OutputMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the Output Mode of the Camera. The new setting is enabled when the power is turned off and then back on again.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the Output Mode of the Camera. The new setting is enabled when the power is turned off and then back on again. It is saved persistent directly when it is set. No UserSetSave is needed.

Integer.Name: PayloadSize
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel. This includes any end-of-line, end-of-frame statistics or other stamp data. This is the total size of data payload for a data block.
Integer.Description: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel. This includes any end-of-line, end-of-frame statistics or other stamp data. This is the total size of data payload for a data block.

Enumeration.Name: PhaseShift
Enumeration.ToolTip: Phase Shift for camera clock
Enumeration.Description: Phase Shift for camera clock

Enumeration.Name: PictureEffect
Enumeration.ToolTip: It consists of the following functions. [Neg. Art]: Negative/Positive Reversal. [Black White]: Monochrome Image.
Enumeration.Description: It consists of the following functions. [Neg. Art]: Negative/Positive Reversal. [Black White]: Monochrome Image.

EnumEntry.Name: Negative
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Negative/Positive Reversal
EnumEntry.Description: Negative/Positive Reversal

EnumEntry.Name: BlackAndWhite
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Monochrome Image
EnumEntry.Description: Monochrome Image

Boolean.Name: PictureFreeze
Boolean.ToolTip: Captures an image in the field memory of the camera so that this image can be output continuously.
Boolean.Description: Captures an image in the field memory of the camera so that this image can be output continuously.

Enumeration.Name: PixelFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Pixel format of image pixels.
Enumeration.Description: Memory layout, meaning and range of pixels in an image.

EnumEntry.Name: BayerGR8
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Bayer GR8
EnumEntry.Description: Bayer GR8

EnumEntry.Name: BayerRG8
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Bayer RG8
EnumEntry.Description: Bayer RG8

EnumEntry.Name: RGB8Packed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: RGB8 Packed
EnumEntry.Description: RGB8 Packed

EnumEntry.Name: YUV422Packed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: YUV422 Packed
EnumEntry.Description: YUV422 Packed

EnumEntry.Name: YUV444Packed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: YUV444 Packed
EnumEntry.Description: YUV444 Packed

EnumEntry.Name: YCBCR709_422
EnumEntry.ToolTip: YCBCR709_422
EnumEntry.Description: YCBCR709_422

EnumEntry.Name: YUYVPacked
EnumEntry.ToolTip: YUYVPacked
EnumEntry.Description: YUYVPacked

Category.Name: Root
Category.ToolTip: Contains all public accessible feature nodes.

Boolean.Name: Rotate180
Boolean.ToolTip: Rotates the image 180 degrees.
Boolean.Description: Rotates the image 180 degrees.

Enumeration.Name: ScanMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Scan Mode is available if a interlaced OutputMode is used and deinterlacing is disabled
Enumeration.Description: Scan Mode is available if a interlaced OutputMode is used and deinterlacing is disabled

EnumEntry.Name: PFullFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Odd and even interlaced frames are combined to one full frame image.
EnumEntry.Description: Odd and even interlaced frames are combined to one full frame image.

EnumEntry.Name: PHalfFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Each Interlaced Frame is transferred as seperate frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Each Interlaced Frame is transferred as seperate frame.

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.ToolTip: Height of the image sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: Height of the image sensor in pixels.

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.ToolTip: Width of the image sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: Width of the image sensor in pixels.

IntReg.Name: SerBytesPending
IntReg.ToolTip: Bytes which where received over the serial interface and are not copied to the Receive Buffer. Use Latch Receive Buffer to copy the pending data to the Receive Buffer.
IntReg.Description: Bytes which where received over the serial interface and are not copied to the Receive Buffer. Use Latch Receive Buffer to copy the pending data to the Receive Buffer.

Command.Name: SerLatchReceiveBuff
Command.ToolTip: Copy the pending data to the Receive Buffer.
Command.Description: Copy the pending data to the Receive Buffer.

StringReg.Name: SerReceiveBuff
StringReg.ToolTip: Buffer with the data which was received. Received data has to be copied to the Receive Buffer with Latch Receive Buffer.
StringReg.Description: Buffer with the data which was received. Received data has to be copied to the Receive Buffer with Latch Receive Buffer.

IntReg.Name: SerReceiveBytesCount
IntReg.ToolTip: Number of bytes in the Receive Buffer.
IntReg.Description: Number of bytes in the Receive Buffer.

StringReg.Name: SerSendBuff
StringReg.ToolTip: Buffer with the data which will be send with Send Bytes.
StringReg.Description: Buffer with the data which will be send with Send Bytes.

Integer.Name: SerSendBytesCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of bytes in the Send Buffer which will be send when this value is changed. If read it returns the current number of bytes in the Send Buffer.
Integer.Description: Number of bytes in the Send Buffer which will be send when this value is changed. If read it returns the current number of bytes in the Send Buffer.

Category.Name: SerialControl
Category.ToolTip: Features to control the serial interface.
Category.Description: Features to control the serial interface.

Category.Name: SerialReceive
Category.ToolTip: Receive data from the serial interface.
Category.Description: Receive data from the serial interface.

Category.Name: SerialSend
Category.ToolTip: Send data over the serial interface.
Category.Description: Send data over the serial interface.

Enumeration.Name: SerialSpeed
Enumeration.ToolTip: Speed of the Serial interface.
Enumeration.Description: Speed of the Serial interface.

Enumeration.Name: Shutter
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the shutter speed. Available when ExposureAuto is set to Off or Shutter Priority Auto.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the shutter speed. Available when ExposureAuto is set to Off or Shutter Priority Auto.

Command.Name: ShutterReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the Shutter. Available when ExposureAuto is set to Off or Shutter Priority Auto.
Command.Description: Resets the Shutter. Available when ExposureAuto is set to Off or Shutter Priority Auto.

Enumeration.Name: SlowShutter
Enumeration.ToolTip: When set to Auto, ensures that the slow shutter is set automatically when the brightness drops. Effective only when the AE mode is set to Full Auto.
Enumeration.Description: When set to Auto, ensures that the slow shutter is set automatically when the brightness drops. Effective only when the AE mode is set to Full Auto. Set to Slow Shutter Manual at shipment. [NOTE]: The Slow Shutter Auto function is not available in Wide Dynamic Range mode.

Boolean.Name: StabilizerEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Switching ON the Image Stabilizer reduces image blurring caused by, for example, vibration, which allows you to obtain images without much blurring.
Boolean.Description: Switching ON the Image Stabilizer function reduces image blurring caused by, for example, vibration, which allows you to obtain images without much blurring. A correction effect of approximately 90% is possible for a vibration frequency of around 10 Hz. The Image Stabilizer function employs the digital zoom system, so the angle of view and resolution are changed, but the sensitivity is maintained.

Boolean.Name: StableZoom
Boolean.ToolTip: StableZoom is a function for performing correction using the Image Stabilizer function.
Boolean.Description: StableZoom is a function for performing correction using the Image Stabilizer function in accordance with the zoom ratio, and smoothly zooming up to approximately ?40 using a combination of the optical zoom and digital zoom. The digital zoom can be further used to zoom up to 432x or 336x depending on model. At the wide end, you can obtain images without any reduction in the angle of view and resolution because the digital zoom is not switched ON. On the other hand, at the Tele end, the correction effect by the Image Stabilizer function is at its maximum so blurring is reduced. The StableZoom function can be switched ON/OFF.

Boolean.Name: StandbyEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Sets the power state to standby if enabled.
Boolean.Description: Sets the power state to standby if enabled.

Category.Name: Statistic
Category.ToolTip: Features which show framebuffer statistics.
Category.Description: Features which show framebuffer statistics.

Integer.Name: StatusOutputValueAll
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the value of all the bits of the status outputs. Located on the secondary connector.
Integer.Description: Sets the value of all the bits of the status outputs. Located on the secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). STATUS0:: (+): Pin 16 Ground(-): Pin 19 STATUS1:: (+): Pin 18 Ground(-): Pin 19 STATUS2:: (+): Pin 20 Ground(-): Pin 21 STATUS3:: (+): Pin 22 Ground(-): Pin 21

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Enables or disables a test image that is sent by the camera.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is coming from the sensor.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is coming from the sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Test image is sent by the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: Test image is sent by the camera.

Category.Name: TransportLayerControl
Category.ToolTip: This Category contains all GigE Vision Transport Layer Control features.
Category.Description: This Category contains all GigE Vision Transport Layer Control features.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the activation mode of the trigger. RisingEdge: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal. FallingEdge: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the activation mode of the trigger. RisingEdge: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal. FallingEdge: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.

Integer.Name: TriggerDebouncingPeriodRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Raw Value of the active debouncing Period. The Value is multiplied with 16ns which results in the active debouncing Period in [ns].
Integer.Description: Raw Value of the active debouncing Period. The Value is multiplied with 16ns which results in the active debouncing Period in [ns].

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the selected trigger is active.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the selected trigger is active. It can take any of the following values: Off: Disables the selected trigger. On: Enable the selected trigger.

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.ToolTip: Generates an internal trigger.
Command.Description: Generates an internal trigger.

Enumeration.Name: UserOutputSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which bit of the User Output register will be set by UserOutputValue.

EnumEntry.Name: UserOutput0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital Output 0. Located on the Primary connector (SubD DA-15). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out0(+): Pin 12 Out0 Ground(-): Pin 13
EnumEntry.Description: Digital Output 0. Located on the Primary connector (SubD DA-15). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out0(+): Pin 12 Out0 Ground(-): Pin 13

EnumEntry.Name: UserOutput1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital Output 1. Located on the Secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out1(+): Pin 14 Out1 Ground(-): Pin 9
EnumEntry.Description: Digital Output 1. Located on the Secondary connector (Male Header, SMD 1.27mm pitch). A TTL signal is used (0V low 5V high). Out1(+): Pin 14 Out1 Ground(-): Pin 9

Boolean.Name: UserOutputValue
Boolean.ToolTip: Sets the value of the output selected by UserOutputSelector. UserOutputValue can take any of the following values: TRUE: Sets the output to High. FALSE: Sets the output to Low.
Boolean.Description: Sets the value of the output selected by UserOutputSelector. UserOutputValue can take any of the following values: TRUE: Sets the output to High. FALSE: Sets the output to Low.

Category.Name: UserSetControl
Category.ToolTip: With these features you can save/load the settings from/to the non-volatile memory of the camera.
Category.Description: With these features you can save/load the settings from/to the non-volatile memory of the camera.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefaultSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: If Default is selected, the device will boot with the default factory settings.
Enumeration.Description: If Default is selected, the device will boot with the default factory settings.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will boot with the default factory settings
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will boot with the default factory settings

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 1
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 1

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 2
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 2

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 3
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 3

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 4
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will boot with feature values saved with UserSet 4

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.
Command.Description: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.ToolTip: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the camera.
Command.Description: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the camera.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will load the default factory settings
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will load the default factory settings

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 1
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 1

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 2
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 2

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 3
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 3

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 4
EnumEntry.Description: If selected, the device will load/save the feature values for UserSet 4

Enumeration.Name: WDRBlockedUp
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select from four levels for blocked-up shadow correction.
Enumeration.Description: Select from four levels for blocked-up shadow correction.

Enumeration.Name: WDRBlownOut
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select from three levels for blown-out highlight correction.
Enumeration.Description: Select from three levels for blown-out highlight correction.

Category.Name: WDRCat
Category.ToolTip: Features to control the Wide Dynamic Range acquisition.
Category.Description: Features to control the Wide Dynamic Range acquisition.

Enumeration.Name: WDRDetectionSensitivity
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select from three levels for detecting the intensity within the image when switching from OFF to ON in the automatic wide dynamic range mode.
Enumeration.Description: Select from three levels for detecting the intensity within the image when switching from OFF to ON in the automatic wide dynamic range mode.

Integer.Name: WDRExposureRatio
Integer.ToolTip: Parameter to use in the exposure ratio mode. Specify the short exposure time by setting the magnification ratio (x1 to x150) with regards to a long exposure time.
Integer.Description: Parameter to use in the exposure ratio mode. Specify the short exposure time by setting the magnification ratio (x1 to x150) with regards to a long exposure time.

Enumeration.Name: WDRImageMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Determines the mode how the wide dynamic range image is displayed.
Enumeration.Description: Determines the mode how the wide dynamic range image is displayed.

EnumEntry.Name: CombinedImage
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Combines the two acquired images to one combined image.
EnumEntry.Description: Combines the two acquired images to one combined image.

EnumEntry.Name: SplittedImage
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Splits the image into two images with half horizontal resolution. The left image is the long time acquired image. The right image is the short time acquired image.
EnumEntry.Description: Splits the image into two images with half horizontal resolution. The left image is the long time acquired image. The right image is the short time acquired image.

EnumEntry.Name: ShortTime
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Show only short time acquired image.
EnumEntry.Description: Show only short time acquired image.

EnumEntry.Name: LongTime
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Show only long time acquired image.
EnumEntry.Description: Show only long time acquired image.

Enumeration.Name: WDRMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: The wide dynamic range can be set to be automatically switched ON/OFF in accordance with the intensity difference obtained by dividing an image into several blocks and then averaging the intensity of each block.
Enumeration.Description: The Wide Dynamic Range mode is a function for dividing an image into several blocks and correcting blocked-up shadows and saturated highlights in accordance with the intensity difference. It enables you to obtain images in which portions ranging from dark to light can be recognized, even when capturing a subject with a large intensity difference that is backlit or includes extremely light portions. A CCD for shooting a wide dynamic range is employed, and a newly developed image signal processor combines a long exposure signal (normal shutter) and a signal of the high intensity portions obtained by a short exposure (high-speed shutter) to achieve images with a wide dynamic range. NOTE: When the wide dynamic range mode is ON, solarization may be observed in the images of some subjects. This phenomenon is unique to wide dynamic range mode, and is not an indication of a camera malfunction.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode corrects blocked-up shadows and saturated highlights in accordance with the intensity difference.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode corrects blocked-up shadows and saturated highlights in accordance with the intensity difference.

EnumEntry.Name: Auto
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode switches WD ON/OFF automatically in accordance with the intensity difference of the subject. Configure the sensitivity for when WD is switched from OFF to ON with the detection sensitivity parameter.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode switches WD ON/OFF automatically in accordance with the intensity difference of the subject. Configure the sensitivity for when WD is switched from OFF to ON with the detection sensitivity parameter.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureRatio
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode fixes the shutter speed of a short exposure. Configure the shutter speed of a long exposure by setting the ratio with regards to a short exposure with the exposure ratio parameter. Blocked-up shadow correction is not performed in this mode.

EnumEntry.Name: Histogram
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode uses a histogram to correct blocked-up shadows and saturated highlights
EnumEntry.Description: This mode uses a histogram to correct blocked-up shadows and saturated highlights

Command.Name: WDRRefresh
Command.ToolTip: Refresh Wide Dynamic Range.
Command.Description: Refresh Wide Dynamic Range.

Category.Name: WhiteBalance
Category.ToolTip: White Balance features.
Category.Description: White Balance features.

Integer.Name: Width
Integer.ToolTip: Width of the image in pixels. Default is the width of the effective pixels. (748 pixels).
Integer.Description: Width of the image in pixels. Default is the width of the effective pixels. (748 pixels).

Category.Name: ZoomControl
Category.ToolTip: Zoom features.
Category.Description: Zoom features.

Enumeration.Name: ZoomControlMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which zoom control method is used. ZoomDrive uses the ZoomPlus, ZoomMinus features in the ZoomDrive Category to drive the zoom until it is stopped with ZoomStop by the user. ZoomTarget uses the ZoomPositionTarget feature to go to a specific zoom position.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which zoom control method is used. ZoomDrive uses the ZoomPlus, ZoomMinus features in the ZoomDrive Category to drive the zoom until it is stopped with ZoomStop by the user. ZoomTarget uses the ZoomPositionTarget feature to go to a specific zoom position.

EnumEntry.Name: ZoomDrive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Controls the zoom with the Zoom Drive commands.
EnumEntry.Description: Controls the zoom with the Zoom Drive commands.

EnumEntry.Name: ZoomTarget
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Controls the zoom with the Zoom Target value.
EnumEntry.Description: The Zoom Position is changed to the target value.

Boolean.Name: ZoomDEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enable/Disable the digital zoom.
Boolean.Description: Enable/Disable the digital zoom.

Category.Name: ZoomDrive
Category.ToolTip: Features to control the Zoom Drive when ZoomControl is set to ZoomDrive.
Category.Description: Features to control the Zoom Drive when ZoomControl is set to ZoomDrive.

Integer.Name: ZoomFactor
Integer.ToolTip: Current Zoom Factor
Integer.Description: Current Zoom Factor

Command.Name: ZoomMinus
Command.ToolTip: Starts the Zoom Drive to Zoom out (Wide).
Command.Description: Starts the Zoom Drive to Zoom out (Wide).

Integer.Name: ZoomMinusSpeed
Integer.ToolTip: Zoom speed in minus direction (Wide).0(slow)->7(Fast)
Integer.Description: Zoom speed in minus direction (Wide).0(slow)->7(Fast)

EnumEntry.Name: Analog
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Controls optical zoom

EnumEntry.Name: Digital
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Controls digital zoom

EnumEntry.Name: Combined
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Optical and digital zoom combined
EnumEntry.Description: Combines optical and digital zoom

Command.Name: ZoomPlus
Command.ToolTip: Starts the Zoom Drive to Zoom in (Tele)
Command.Description: Starts the Zoom Drive to Zoom in (Tele)

Integer.Name: ZoomPlusSpeed
Integer.ToolTip: Zoom speed in plus direction (Tele).0(slow)->7(Fast).
Integer.Description: Zoom speed in plus direction (Tele).0(slow)->7(Fast).

Integer.Name: ZoomPosition
Integer.ToolTip: Displays the current zoom position.
Integer.Description: Displays the current zoom position.

Integer.Name: ZoomPositionTarget
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the zoom position to a specific value. Available when ZoomControlMode is set to ZoomTarget.
Integer.Description: Sets the zoom position to a specific value. Available when ZoomControlMode is set to ZoomTarget.

Command.Name: ZoomStop
Command.ToolTip: Stops the Zoom Drive .
Command.Description: Stops the Zoom Drive .
